statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ 0 \\ 7 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 3 \\ -9 \\ 6 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ 0 \\ 7 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 3 \\ -9 \\ 6 \end{array}\right].
